Janet's Homepage
CV Contact

Welcome to my homepage! I am a 5th year Ph.D. candidate in Statistics at North Carolina State University, advised by Prof. Sujit Ghosh.

My research interests include time series forecasting, machine learning, and optimization. I specialize in enhancing the sample efficiency of time series forecasting using advanced machine learning methods with applications on financial stock market and coronavirus epidemiology.I also work on developing efficient zeroth-order global optimization solutions for black-box optimization challenges.

Publications

Xinyu Zhang, Sujit Ghosh. Dual Efficient Forecasting Framework for Time Series Data. arXiv (2022)

Runzhe Wan, Xinyu Zhang, and Rui Song. Multi-Objective Model-based Reinforcement Learning for Infectious Disease Control. Proceedings of the 27th ACM SIGKDD Conference on Knowledge Discovery & Data Mining (2021)

Li, Qing, Kehui Yao, and Xinyu Zhang. A Change-Point Detection and Clustering Method in the Recurrent-Event Context. Journal of Statistical Computation and Simulation 90.6 (2020)

Awards

Funding for Research on Time Series Forecasting Reconciliation, Meta Platforms, Inc. (09/2022)

Best Narrative - Cherry Blossom Prediction Competition, George Mason University (05/2022)

First Prize - National Training Program of Innovation and Entrepreneurship, Nankai University (05/2017)

Presentations

Multi-Objective Reinforcement Learning for Infectious Disease Control with Application to COVID-19 Spread, ACM Conference on Health, Inference, and Learning (04/2021)

Abundance Estimation of White-tailed Deer in Shenandoah National Park, National Wildlife Health Center of the United States Geological Survey, Madison, Wisconsin (05/2019)
